sentences.sContent: He gradually insinuated himself into her life.
sentences.sCn: 他一步步巧妙地走进了她的生活。

synos.tran: 暗示；使逐渐而巧妙地取得；使迂回地潜入

remMethod.val: in(进入) + sinu(弯曲) + ate → 绕弯说出来 → 暗指

words.tran: 暗示；使…潜入；讨好（insinuate的ing形式）

trans.tranCn: 使逐步而巧妙地取得, 使迂回地潜入(或挤入), 使慢慢滋长, 含沙射影地说
trans.tranOther: If you say that someone insinuates themselves into a particular situation, you mean that they manage very cleverly, and perhaps dishonestly, to get into that situation
